name: The Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A wonderful hotel. Would definately stay here again
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed in this hotel for our "Girls Getaway", and we were not disappointed. The rooms were chic and modern. The staff was attentive and helpful. The location was PERFECT. This will be my official hotel of choice when visiting SOBE!
reviews.title: SOBE hotels take note! Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I grew up in Miami and Lived in Miami Beach until the 90's. The Hotel still has managed to maintain the Miami Beach experience with its architecture and service. Sobe is definitely NOT what it used to be and i thank the gods i stayed at this hotel to get away from the crazy kids and hip hop crowd. The highlight is the rooftop pool and bar, and though the actual restaurant Wish(i was bummed about this) is closed, the hotel food is fresh, light and delicious, very relaxing. The clientele was nice as well. Service is a big deal to me and they will not disappoint, very professional, friendly and accommodating, just what the girls needed for a relaxing vacay
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in July for 1 night for our 1st wedding anniversary. We loved this hotel. The staff was fantastic and very helpful. The concierge, the bellman, and the pool bar tenders were all super nice, helpful and friendly. I especially want to single out David, who helped us with parking, our baggage, and helping us get around South Beach since it was our first time there. The rooftop pool is awesome with a really great view, service and cool pool water which is great because of the hot weather.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Another plus ia that you get free beach chairs on the beach. The location is in the heart of South Beach, you cannot beat it.
reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not fault the hotel at all. Everything from the food to the staff to the location is superb.
reviews.title: Top class spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: The rooftop pool is fantastic and the service is excellent without being overly attentive.
reviews.title: Annual Trek

likes.disliked: — Rooms are good, stylish, but a bit worn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Everything we required, from restaurant recommendations to needing to store luggage as we were heading on a cruise to transport were no problem to teh extremely friendly staff.
reviews.title: Perfect in just about every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it's teh only hotel I've stayed at in South Beach I cab gaurantee that you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Funky and Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our 4th time at The Hotel in the last 5 years. Great locale, great pool on the roof and close to all. The room's are good, but could use a bit of an update now. We still look forward to going back next Dec though. The staff are excellent, and it's interesting that we've seen the same folks there for 5 years. No changes. Wish Restaurant is great. Great ambiance, service, food. Also hit Grazie for good Italian, Espanola Way for Mexican. Okay chow on Ocean. It's a hassle to walk it at night, but you gotta do it. We travel 3-4 times a year, stay at 4-5 stars mainly and are comfotable in boutiques or large hotels. Don't expect super luxury, but The Hotel deserves its rating and is a comfortable place to stay. The rooftop pool makes it. I'd recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: A Bit of Style But Don't Expect To Sleep In!

likes.disliked: — Charging for parking is $17 a day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Newly refurbished, this hotel with the strange name of "The" is an absolute gem. I am told that some of the rooms can be noisy as the hotel is very close to the ocean front action but ours was quiet but with no view - the windows were frosted over! We give this hotel five stars for service, a pity there is no room for six. The staff were the most couteous and helpful we have ever come across in many years of staying at US hotels.
reviews.title: Wonderful little boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used valet parking, it cost an extra $10 a day, but the car was there for us in minutes if we wanted it. Its not a big hotel but we cannot recommend this hotel too highly.
reviews.title: Superb - rooftop pool, restaurant and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pity there was no coffee/tea maker in the room, but there was an abundance of coffe shops nearby, with the genuine Italian Pinnochio less than 20 metres away. Here again, the staff were very helpful if you did not want to eat in the pretty restaurant. We opted for the special deals on Ocean Drive about 30 metres away.
reviews.title: A Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Another plus, I got on the free Internet each and every time I tried, without having to get in line (queueing).
reviews.title: A gem in the middle of it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights.
reviews.title: Don't understand the good reviews for this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With so many options of places to stay in South Beach, I really wanted to find the perfect place for a long weekend with my boyfriend. After reading the high ratings and positive feedback this hotel had, I booked a room and was very happy with our stay. Our flight arrived mid Friday morning, so we were able to check into the hotel early without a problem. The staff was very helpful and curtious upon arrival, and made sure we were settled in comfortably. The concierge services were also really helpful in finding actitives and recommendations of things to do during our stay. One of my favorited parts of the hotel is the rooftop pool/bar. Before arriving, I was worried it would be very crowded during the weekend, but it was the complete opposite. We had no problem getting chairs (really comfortable!) facing the ocean, and enjoying the pool which was never crowded. The rooftop had a very relaxing environment, with people enjoying drinks or cooling off in the pool. This was a great altervative from the more crowded (but still fun) beach if you wanted to relax a little before or after going out (the chairs that come with the room reservation at the beach were also a nice perk!). The location of the this hotel is also amazing - right across from the beach, 1 block away from ocean drive, close to high end shopping and restaurants, it had everything! It was also really easy to access taxi or shuttle transportation to the airport (we flew out of Ft. Lauderdale so we used GoShuttle). The rooms were nice, and actually bigger than I thought they would be. Overall, I was very happy we decided to stay at The Hotel and would recommend this place to anyone! I would absolutley stay here again :)
reviews.title: Perfect place for a long weekend!
Our favorite hotel in South Beach!
reviews.text: We've stayed at many different hotels in South Beach over the years but based on service and quality for the price we paid, there isn't one that we couldn't wait to return to - until now! The Hotel is a small hidden gem in South Beach and for the price we paid, the quality of the room, amenities and service - it was absolutely perfect in our book! Loved the rooftop deck, pool, and bar. Room was well-appointed and quiet and the staff went above and beyond when we had a delayed flight. We travel to South Beach at least once a year, if not more, and can't wait to be back at The Hotel! Thanks again for a great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on its Trip Advisor rank and the great feedback from other guests and I wasn't disappointed! I won't repeat everyone else's feedback but the room was great-was on third floor so away from noise from lift and street below but also had a nice ocean view. I regret not using roof top pool more as frozen mojitos were so good and bar service while you are lounging excellent. Also we didn't try the Wish restaurant at the hotel but this was always busy so must have been good. Only cons were that lift was really slow (whole hotel only 3stories we were just being lazy) and they should name the hotel something rather than just "the hotel" as reservations to tour operators and restaurants required extra explaining. Don't let that stop you though. Location great for beach.
reviews.title: The best service and value in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Quality / Value , very good Location,The Wifi didn't work with Ipad ! they were not able to fixe it.
reviews.title: We love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a couple of days and I really enjoyed it - Though on Business, I decided to book this hotel assuming that I was much more of a leisure hotel than the.... Incontercontinental for instance. I was right.
reviews.title: A very good hotel for leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel has a great location and fancy bathtub warm rooftop pool and bar. The decor was fun and very Miami Beach. I was impressed but my husband found it a bit more standard than he expected (but we were in the cheap rooms!). Some of the staff very chirpy and friendly, unfortunately some were very snooty which may be a Miami Beach thing but is a bit much when you are paying for the privilege.
reviews.title: Stylish but with attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights at the back end of a business trip in October 2008. The room was very nice, nicely designed with a massive and very comfortable bed, a large tv and some nice touches like a stereo with an ipod docking station and best of all free wireless internet. I liked the colour scheme in the room a lot. The bathroom was a bit small, but the shower was nice. There was a small problem with the toilet continually flushing, but it was resolved swiftly as soon as I mentioned it to the front desk.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel isn't beachfront, which is a shame in a way as it would be nice to have an ocean view, but has benefits in another sense in that it means you're not right on Ocean Drive where it can be quite noisy late at night. The location is good though, just one block from Ocean Drive and right next to some major shops at the end of Collins Avenue.
reviews.title: Pictures and reviews are true - excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was quite impressed by the Hotel but it was expensive, and it does suffer from a little bit of the pretentiousness that would seem to mark most of South Beach. The staff were very friendly and courteous though I'd have to say and I can't really complain about the Hotel at all.
reviews.title: Great Time in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During my research over the years on hotels, I found that in a lot of cases, the pictures turn out to be outdated -but in this case - The Hotel of South Beach photos on this website and others are exactly as it truly is - the actual pool, bars and Wish Restaurant are even more glorious than the photos depict. The Staff was wonderful - housekeeping twice daily, the hotel itself is ultra clean, even though some of the carpets were a bit worn, they smelled clean and there was no mustiness whatsoever. Rooms a bit small but that is the norm for boutique hotels - but nicely decorated. As long as I can afford it - I will stay here again and again - no need to look for another hotel - plus - it's in the heart of all the action , yet quiet enough for resting.
reviews.title: Wonderful time

likes.disliked: — The room was a little dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a night at The Hotel recently on the way back from the Bahamas. We stayed in one of the new rooms on the Ocean Blvd. side of the hotel and loved it. The room itself was great, with a very comfortable bed and excellent bathroom. What we loved most, though, was the 2nd floor balcony we had (we were room #227) looking out right over 8th and Ocean. Just a fabulous place to sip some wine and watch the crowds go by.
reviews.title: Best people-watching place in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at The Hotel after a long business trip in several states, to unwind for a couple of nights.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: The Hotel was great, with a good location near the beach, the shops and the nightlife! The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel had a nice intimate feel after the more corporate business-focused hotels we'd been staying in.
reviews.title: Will be going back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked the design of the place, including the lovely rooftop pool area, which we used a lot, and the really pretty garden-like outdoor dining area. The restaurant was delicious and we had a very lovely breakfast which they were happy to serve us quite late in the morning (after a late night out and no business to have to get out of bed for!).
reviews.title: great hotel, great location. reviews are right on the mark.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: We'd stayed in four hotels before The Hotel on our trip, and we'd had to pay for wi-fi at all of them, so we were delighted to be getting free wi-fi. Except that the internet connection was so slow as to be unusable. I realised that wifi was so important to us that we'd have been prepared to pay if it meant a working reliable service.
reviews.title: Hotel, service and location are all great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days on a trip to Florida. First time in Miami and what an experience! This hotel was the perfect location; only a 2 minute walk to Ocean Drive and 5 mins from South Beach. The hotel was clean with a really large room and very comfy double bed. We then hired a car and travelled to the Keys from Miami and the Conceirge John, was SO helpful. He helped us book a hire car, a hotel and marked out our route on a map. The staff overall were very friendly. My only criticism would be the prices of the bars, both in the main restaurant area and by the pool. Both were extortionate so we used them once and never again!
reviews.title: Excellent location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent. Excellent. Excellent.
reviews.title: Surpassed our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location: Perfect. 801 Collins Avenue at 8th Street. One block from the beach and the main strip (Ocean Drive). Close to everything and literally right in the heart of South Beach. Being that one short block away from the craziness makes all the difference in terms of getting a quiet, restful sleep.
reviews.title: nice hotel on south beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Quite nice. Have seen nicer but room was clean and spacious and had a great window seat/bench for people watching. Bathroom was bright and clean and large; shower was great with rain shower head. Try to get a room that looks out on to Collins Avenue or 8th Street (room 320 on Collins was great) - perfect for people watching and more pleasant (I would think) than being on the other side of the building facing the alley.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: Amenities: Great! Roof top pool/was awesome and is open until 8:00pm with full service bar and menu - food is brought right to your lounge chair or table. The view from the pool looking out over the beach was fantastic. Alcoholic beverages a bit pricey. Roof top lounge (Spire) is open Thursday to Sunday. Very neat ambiance. It was not at all busy - not sure why. Maybe because it was the off season? Drinks at Spire were the same price as at the pool bar. Restaurant (Wish) was good. Only had breakfast there but no complaints. Business centre was simple but free and allowed us to do advance flight check in on line and print our boarding passes. Wi-Fi access was free. Signal was a little spotty (i.e. signal dropped from time to time) but it was generally fine and...did I mention free?! The Hotel does not charge a resort fee - this is a big deal! Most of the hotels we researched in the area charge a "resort fee", averaging $20 per night, for use of facilities/pools/lounge chairs/beach chairs/Wi-Fi/etc, regarless of use (or non-use). Everything is included here without the fee. **TIP - sign up for the hotel's Gold Card online. There are some definite perks (including freebies and discounts throughout the hotel)**
reviews.title: Stay away from the third floor over the cafe. The aircon will literally keep you up ALL night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I find it incomprehensible how this can be among the top hotels in Miami Beach and have a 4-5 star rating. When I checked in, I got a room that was so small, I could barely move. The window was frosted so you couldn't even see outside - for good reason, since the view was so ugly. But, worst of all, the quality of construction in this building is equivalent to what one would expect to find in a low-end entry-level strip mall condominium complex. The walls are paper thin and every sound from adjacent rooms and the hallway can be heard (in fact, is echoed). The noise was so loud from the guest above that I had to request another room. I got another room that was a little bigger, actually had real windows (the kind you can see through), but was still incredibly noisy. I could hear noise from adjacent rooms on both sides, the hallway, and above. But, worst of all, the speakers in the lobby that are constantly blasting fake thumping nightclub music were right below this unit, and all day long, I couldn't think, due to "thump, thump, thump ..." of the bass. And they never played anything that didn't thump. The staff were incredibly nice and when I complained they turned it down low enough so that I could no longer hear it, but they kept turning it up, so I had to keep asking over and over and over again. The walls are cheap stucco drywall from the 70's - the kind where they spray white stuff on drywall then squish it into flat surfaces on the wall. The carpets were worn and dirty in the entire hotel, not just the room. The elevator was always broken. I'd be inclined to give this place 2 stars but I am giving them an extra star for the staff. The staff at this hotel was truly among the best anywhere. Incredibly attentive and friendly and caring. And, the location was great - near food, shopping, and beach.
reviews.title: Vastly Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location! Friendly, very helpful and attentative staff. The room and bathroom was however very small, not suited for a long stay, but nicely decorated and the bed very comfortable. Great rooftop pool and the view from the gym makes you go an extra mile. The restaurant is very, very good, with a wonderful outdoor dining area - you should definetly have at least one dinner there!
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attentive service, great rooftop pool. You can see the ocean from the rooftop pool. The lounge chairs are clean and are all covered with a large towel. They offer Yoga at 11am on Saturdays. The gym is clean with up to date equipment.
reviews.title: Great pool, gym + luxury beach chairs included

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have luxury beach chairs that have the thickest cushion of all the beach chairs available on the beach. The restaurant is delicious. Free WiFi.
reviews.title: Would definitely go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The decor was unique and fun--using bright playful colors and tie dyed patterns in a classy manner.
reviews.title: Loved it!

description: Originally built in 1939, by master architect L. Murray Dixon, today the hotel encompasses 73 deluxe rooms and suites, a rooftop pool with panoramic ocean views and Spire Bar & Lounge – a chic hot spot located rooftop behind the historic Tiffany spire. The new oceanfront addition to The Hotel of South Beach offers 20 breathtaking deluxe rooms, located at 800 Ocean Drive, bringing The Hotel of South Beach’s rooms and suites down to the ocean.
